title: Collapsible session side panel
notes: User wants to collapse/hide the session list sidebar to give more room to the active chat
interpretation: Standard collapsible sidebar pattern — toggle the session list panel open/closed to maximize chat area, especially on narrower viewports or when focused on a single session. Likely wants persistent state (stays collapsed across navigation) and a clear toggle affordance.

title: Richer session status beyond thinking/online
notes: Other statuses than just thinking and online
interpretation: The session list currently only distinguishes 'thinking' (agent mid-turn) and 'online' (connected). User wants more granular statuses visible at a glance — likely things like waiting for permission, running a command, reading/writing files, idle, errored, or completed. This is about situational awareness when managing multiple agents: knowing which ones need attention vs. which are happily working vs. which are stuck.

title: Session age timer in session list
notes: Togglable session age timer thing. '5m' '4s' or whatever, subdued, on the session list
interpretation: Relative time-since-last-activity label on each session row — '4s', '5m', '2h' — in a subdued/muted style so it doesn't compete with the title. Togglable so it can be hidden if unwanted. Live-updating, showing how long since the last message or event. Gives instant triage info: which sessions are fresh vs. stale.

title: Quick-switch between active sessions on mobile
notes: Figure out a better way to navigate between a couple or a few agents on mobile. Going back to the session list just shows a bunch of lines that look the same. Not intuitive which one to go back to.
interpretation: The full session list is the wrong UI for the common mobile workflow of bouncing between 2-3 active agents. All the rows look identical and you have to hunt for the right one every time. The user wants a faster, more differentiated switching mechanism — could be a recent-sessions strip/tab bar, swipe-to-switch gestures, or a compact 'active now' overlay that only shows the few sessions you're currently juggling. The core problem is that the session list treats 'browse all sessions' and 'switch back to one I was just in' as the same interaction, but on mobile they should feel very different.

title: Follow-up: more statuses + custom statuses/colors
notes: Waiting/monitoring (for CI? Anything?). Special color for when working a bead. Custom statuses/colors — might not be feasible though.
interpretation: Expanding on idea-032: add a 'waiting/monitoring' status for when an agent is blocked on an external process (CI, build, deploy). Also a distinct visual treatment when a session is working on a bead — connecting the session to its task context visually. The wild card is user-defined custom statuses with custom colors — full personalization of the status system. Feasibility concern is real: custom statuses would need CLI-side reporting (agents would need to emit arbitrary status strings), plus storage, plus UI. Could start with a fixed set of rich statuses and leave custom as a stretch goal.

title: Tool inputs/results modal bad on mobile
notes: The 'inputs' and 'results' modal on mobile really kinda sucks. Follow-up: everything except dismissal friction. Should be optimized for viewing CLI commands and JSON — viewport sizing, scrolling, font readability.
interpretation: When you tap a tool call in the chat to see its inputs and results, the modal that opens is a poor mobile experience. Main issues: viewport sizing, scroll behavior for long outputs, and code/JSON readability at mobile font sizes. Dismissal is fine. The modal needs to be optimized for its primary content types: CLI commands and JSON payloads. Think horizontal scroll for wide lines, proper monospace sizing, syntax-aware formatting.

title: Clickable link to spawned child session in chat
notes: When an agent spawns another session, there should always be a clickable link in the chat to navigate to it
interpretation: When a session uses spawn_session to create a child session, the resulting chat message/event should include a tappable link that navigates directly to the new session. Currently you have to go find the spawned session in the session list manually. Especially painful on mobile where session discovery is already weak (see idea-034). This is about maintaining the parent-child navigation flow — you're reading the parent's chat, it spawns something, you should be able to follow that thread in one tap.

title: Silence button on rate limit messages/notifications
notes: A 'silence' button on rate limit messages/notifications
interpretation: Rate limit messages are noisy and repetitive — you already know you're rate limited, you don't need every notification about it. A one-tap 'silence' button on the rate limit message or notification would suppress further rate limit alerts for that session (or globally). Related to idea-012 (dedupe/suppress rate limit messages) but this is user-initiated muting rather than automatic deduplication. Quick escape hatch when the noise gets annoying.

title: Follow-up: idle status definition
notes: Idle status: no unreads, no activity in x minutes
interpretation: Defining what 'idle' means for idea-032's status system: a session is idle when it has no unread messages AND no activity for some threshold of time. This distinguishes truly dormant sessions from ones that are just quiet but have unread content waiting. Helps with triage — idle sessions can be visually deprioritized or dimmed in the list.

title: System prompt should suggest updating title on topic change
notes: The hapi injected system prompt should probably be amended to suggest updating the title whenever the conversation subject changes
interpretation: The system prompt currently only tells agents to set the chat title at session start. But sessions often drift — you start debugging auth and end up refactoring the DB layer. The title stays stale. Should amend the injected prompt to also nudge agents to update the title when the conversation focus shifts significantly, so session titles stay useful for later discovery.

title: No visual feedback during context compaction
notes: Priority bug: compaction doesn't appear to have any visual notification. Just shows 'thinking' for a long time.
interpretation: When Claude Code triggers context compaction mid-session, the web UI has no distinct indicator for it. It just shows the normal 'thinking' spinner, which during compaction can last a long time. The user has no way to distinguish 'agent is working' from 'agent is compacting context and will resume shortly'. Needs a specific visual state — either a different status label, a progress message, or at minimum a tooltip/subtitle explaining what's happening. High priority because it looks like a hang to the user.
